¨Lord, help my poor soul.¨ On October 17, 1849, Joseph W. Walker found Edgar Allan Poe unconscious in a Baltimore gutter. He took EAP to the hospital. The cause of his death still remains a mystery. Many conspiracy theories surround EAP´s death. One of the most common theories is that he died of consuming too much alcohol. Although, It's been 168 years since EAP died, but no one has been able to solve the mystery of his death. The theory that he died of drinking sounds right to many people because it has some background to it. EAP started drinking at a very early stage of life because of everything happening around him. He started drinking because he wanted to take some time not thinking about his horrible past. His drinking even got worse after his wife, Virginia died from Tuberculosis. Just like the rest of his loved one died. …show more content…

¨Poe became a vocal member of the temperance movement, eschewing alcohol, which he’d struggled with all his life.¨ It doesn't explain his five day disappearance. Also, a different pair clothes were found on his body when he was found unconscious. So, why would he be wearing different clothes if he died from drinking too much alcohol. It also does not explain the ¨levels of mercury found in Poe's hair.¨ Too much mercury in your body can cause Mercury poisoning. It also explains his hallucinations and delirium before his death. At the same time, there are some people who agree with this death theory. However, there are a lot more people how disagree with this theory because he was going to get married soon. Furthermore, I personally believe that this theory was wrong because Edgar Allan Poe was attending temperance movements.
